newsitem.title: USA: Yamana signs Papua New Guinea deal.
newsitem.headline: Yamana signs Papua New Guinea deal.

text.p: Yamana Resources Inc said on Tuesday it has signed an agreement in principle to earn up to a 51 percent interest in the gold exploration licences of Union Mining NL.
The agreement also allows Yamana to buy up to a 17.1 percent equity interest in Union, based in Australia, Yamana said in a statement.

Under the agreement, Yamana will acquire five million Union treasury shares at A$0.13 per share, five million Union treasury shares at A$0.14 per share and five million shares in a market transaction at A$0.14 per share, for a total equity investment of A$2.05 million, Yamana said.
Yamana will also buy 17 million tradeable options to acquire an equivalent number of treasury shares at A$0.20 per share, exercisable to May 31, 2000.
On an undiluted basis, Yamana will hold 10.3 percent of Union's equity. On a fully diluted basis, assuming all existing options are exercised, it will hold 17.1 percent.
To earn a 51 percent interest in Union's Papua New Guinea interests, Yamana must spend A$9 million on exploration over four years. Yamana has an option to increase its interest to 75 percent.
